section.title: Identity Manager Preferences
section.para: To use the features of Identity Manager provided by the extension you need to configure the preferences.

important.para: Unless you have it not done now all gallery items will be hidden.

warning.para: The preference node for this feature will only be visible if you have the plug-in enabled. Refer to Feature Configuration if you cannot find the preference node described here.

section.para: Complete the following steps to configure Identity Manager extension plug-in:

listitem.para: Navigate to the menu Tools | Preferences.
This opens the Preferences Dialog of Oracle JDeveloper 12c.
In the left hand tree scroll down and select the node Identity and Access Management. Due to the extension plug-in isn't loaded, request to load it.
Click Load Extension. Now the preferences that needs to be configured and are common for all dependencies are visible.
Select the preference node Identity Manager that's now is visible. Due to the extension plug-in isn't loaded, request to load it.
Click Load Extension. Now the preferences that needs to be configured especially for Identity Manager features of the extension plug-in.

section.title: General
section.para: To configure Identity Manager you have to provide in the section General:

row.entry: The directory of your local file system where the applications and all projects related to Identity Manager are located in a JDeveloper Workspace.
Enter an appropriate name id the recomendate doesn't meet your needs.

entry.emphasis: Path to Identity Manager Foundation Framework

row.entry: The directory of your local file system where you checked out the workspaces provided by Oracle Consulting Services for development of Identity Manager artifacts.

entry.para: If you specified the correct path in Path to Consulting Workspace in the preference panel of Preferences this path is already populated for you.
If not either enter the full qualified path in the text field or use Browse... to pick up the directory from your local file system.

entry.emphasis: Path to Identity Manager Design Console

entry.para: The directory of your local file system where the Design Console of Identity Manager is installed.
You have copied the configured installation from your Identity and Access Management installation. Refere to Design Console
Either enter the full qualified path in the text field or use Browse... to pick up the directory from your local file system.
The directoy that you have to specify is the path to console.cmd on a Windows Operating System or console.sh on a UNIX-like Operating System without the file name.
The extension plug-in itself doesn't make use of the command lines but needs the location to validate the installation before it will accept the path.

section.title: Libraries
section.para: Select the correct Release for Identity Manager.

important.para: This option determind by your target platform of Identity Manager.

section.para: After you entered all necessary paths you should press Generate. By doing so the libraries that you may assign to your projects related to Identity Manager are created for you.

note.para: This activity performs also the validation of the paths that you provided in the section General.

important.para: If an error is reported to you correct the issue and repeat the generation of the libraries.

section.title: Validation
section.para: Validate the existence of libraries created by the step above by clicking Manage... to open the Manage Libraries dialog. Here you can watch if the libraries are matching your environment.
If something might be wrong close the dialog Manage Libraries and repeat the steps General and Libraries.
After you configured Identity Manager preferences you can select a different preference node.

note.para: It is not important to configure all of them. You will only miss some option in the gallery if a specific product is not configured yet.
